questions.question: What is the main goal of synthesizing a novel compound with a N-contents of 66.65%?
questions.answer: The main goal is to pursue ligands with higher energetic properties.

questions.question: What method was used to calculate the heats of formation (HOF) of compounds?
questions.answer: The hybrid DFT-B3LYP methods with the 6-311++G** basis set through designed isodesmic reactions were used.

questions.question: How were the detonation performance parameters of the synthesized energetic coordination polymers (ECPs) calculated?
questions.answer: The detonation performance parameters were calculated by the K-J equation combined with the method reported by Pang et al.

questions.question: What role do hydrogen bonds play in the thermal stability of the compound ATNT?
questions.answer: The higher hydrogen bonding interactions contribute to the better thermal stability of ATNT.

questions.question: What equipment was used to control the input energy onto the composites during the laser detonation experiment?
questions.answer: Laster power supply (Beamech dawa-350) was employed to control the input energy onto the composites.

questions.question: What was the outcome of the laser initiation experiment for the energetic coordination polymers?
questions.answer: Both ECPs were successfully initiated by laser and produced a laser-induced rapid deflagration-to-detonation transition (DDT) process.

questions.question: True or False: The detonation performance of [Ag2(ATNT)4](ClO4)2 is much higher than [Ag2(ATNT)2](NO3)2 due to its higher density.
What is the significance of the Hirshfeld surfaces analysis in the study of the compound ATNT and the ECPs?
questions.answer: The Hirshfeld surfaces analysis helps to better understand the intermolecular interactions, particularly hydrogen bonds, which contribute to the thermal stability and packing of the crystals.

questions.question: True or False: The mechanical stability of AgNO3-based complex is better than AgClO4-based one with the same ligand.
What does the presence of remarkable spikes on the bottom left of the 2D fingerprint plots indicate?
questions.answer: The presence of remarkable spikes indicates intermolecular hydrogen bonds (N-H&H-N and O-H&H-O interactions).
